titleStmt.title: A friendly debate between a Roman Catholick and a Protestant concerning the doctrine of transubstantiation wherein the said doctrine is utterly confuted, and Antichrist is clearly and fully described, and his inevitable destruction predicted : with a challenge to all the Romish doctors that preach and teach the said doctrine, to answer it.
titleStmt.author: Tenison, Thomas, 1636-1715.

titleStmt.title: A friendly debate between a Roman Catholick and a Protestant concerning the doctrine of transubstantiation wherein the said doctrine is utterly confuted, and Antichrist is clearly and fully described, and his inevitable destruction predicted : with a challenge to all the Romish doctors that preach and teach the said doctrine, to answer it.
titleStmt.author: Tenison, Thomas, 1636-1715.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Tenison by Wing and NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Imperfect: cropped and stained with loss of print. Best copy available for photographing.
Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
